newsitem.title: AUSTRIA: bauMax 96 pretax up, sees higher 97 profit. [CORRECTED 10:55 GMT]
newsitem.headline: bauMax 96 pretax up, sees higher 97 profit. [CORRECTED 10:55 GMT]

text.p: (Corrects title to make clear that 1997 profit is seen higher, not lower)
Austria's leading do-it-yourself chain bauMax AG said on Tuesday 1996 group pretax profit rose four percent to 300 million schillings, but added it would cut its dividend by four schillings to 15.

Net profit in the current year is expected to rise to 215 million schillings (corrects from 'pretax profit' to 'net profit'; and from 'expected to fall' to 'expected to rise') while group sales are forecast to climb to 7.8 billion schillings from 7.13 billion in 1996 after 6.83 billion in 1995, the company said in a statement.
To mark the 20th anniversary of the company, bauMax said it would issue a bonus share for every 20 shares held.

Operating profit rose to 354.94 million schillings from 341.58 million in 1995 and earnings per share, based on calculations by the Association of Austrian analysts, slipped to 23.7 schillings from 25.
By mid-morning trade, bauMax shares were trading eight schillings lower at 340 in an overall firm Vienna market. -- Vienna newsroom, +431 531 12256
